[Your Hospital’s Letterhead]

March 20, 2024

Dear ___,

We are writing to provide you with a summary of your recent stay at our hospital, beginning on March 10, 2024. During this time, you were admitted following a fall which resulted in a subsequent loss of consciousness. We understand this has been a worrying time for you and your loved ones, and we wish to provide as much clarity as possible regarding your progress and ongoing care needs.

Upon admission, a Complete Blood Count (CBC) and Coagulation profile were conducted. The test results indicated that your hemoglobin was slightly low and white blood cell count was elevated, with an elevated INR suggesting a prolonged bleeding time. On March 11, a CT scan was performed, which confirmed the presence of a hemorrhagic stroke, specifically an intracerebral hemorrhage in the right hemisphere of your brain.

Your treatment plan included the administration of Mannitol at a dose of 0.25 g/kg every six hours to manage cerebral edema. Additionally, antihypertensive medications were prescribed to control your blood pressure as needed. Throughout your stay, close monitoring of your neurological status was essential.

Initially, upon your presentation, your Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score was recorded at 11, accompanied by slurred speech and right-sided weakness. Unfortunately, there was no significant improvement in these neurological symptoms over the following days, and continued observation revealed agitation and confusion, necessitating safety measures to prevent further falls.

Our medical team, led by Dr. ___, held comprehensive discussions with you and your family about your current health status, prognosis, and the extensive care required moving forward. As of your discharge, it is crucial to continue with your prescribed medication regimen and follow up with your healthcare providers to manage your condition effectively.

Please do not hesitate to reach out to us or your medical team for any further clarification or if you experience any new or concerning symptoms. Our priority is your health and safety, and we are here to support you through your recovery journey.

Wishing you strength and a steady path to recovery.

Sincerely,

[Your Hospital’s Name/Department]

Dr. ___
